meta.description: Meta data of the task like title.

date.help: Enter a date to be used as the creation date. If you do not enter a date, the current date will be used.

can-access-admin.description: Can access the administration for open.SERVICE.
can-access-admin.label: open.SERVICE: Administration access

can-access-dailySchedule.description: Manages the access to daily schedules of tasks
can-access-dailySchedule.label: open.SERVICE: Access to daily schedules

can-access-knowledge.description: Can access the knowledge management plugin.
can-access-knowledge.label: open.SERVICE: Knowledge plugin

can-access-monitor.description: Manages the access to the task system. Also allows admins to create additional task states.

can-access-monitoring.description: Checks the access to the monitoring feature - currently not availabale.
can-access-monitoring.label: open.SERVICE: task manager - Access

can-create-machinelog-message.description: Checks if custom messages can be added to the machinelog
can-create-machinelog-message.label: open.SERVICE: Machinelog - Can add custom messages

can-create-machinelog-schedule.description: Checks if schedules can be created in the machinelog
can-create-machinelog-schedule.label: open.SERVICE: Machinelog - Add schedule

can-create-machinelog-task.description: Checks if tasks can be added to the machinelog
can-create-machinelog-task.label: open.SERVICE: Machinelog - Add tasks

can-create-message.description: Checks if messages can be created (e.g. to a task)
can-create-message.label: open.SERVICE: Messages - Creation

can-create-schedule.description: Checks if schedules can be created.
can-create-schedule.label: open.SERVICE: Schedules - Creation

can-create-ticket.description: Checks if tasks can be created.
can-create-ticket.label: open.SERVICE: task - Creation

can-update-kanban-view.description: Checks if the view can be changed in the task manager.
can-update-kanban-view.label: open.SERVICE: task-Management - Change view

daily_schedule.headline: Daily schedule
daily_schedule.modal_kanban_states_none: Please choose one or more states

user_notice.label: Notice
user_notice.placeholder: Add a notice for yourself before printing

schedule_due.description: Specifies which users are notified when a maintenance plan is due. These users are notified in addition to the permissions on the maintenance plan.
schedule_due.label: Maintenance schedule due

administration.description: The notifications are sent to the selected roles or persons via all configured channels (e.g. WebPush, e-mail, Teams channel). They are also displayed at the top right of the profile.

confirmation.description: Should the data really be stored in the system?
confirmation.title: Really generate?

sampledata.introduction: You can have sample data created here. Several hundred tasks and maintenance plans are then generated. Please use this function with caution.

confirm.content: Do you want to continue the execution?
confirm.title: Continue

confirm.description: Do you really want to delete the execution of the maintenance plan?
confirm.title: Delete execution?

nextschedule.description: Specify when the next maintenance for this plan should take place.

individual.description: Set a completely new execution interval.

newinterval.description: The interval is shifted by the difference. The current execution date is used as the starting time.
newinterval.ininterval: The design is in the plan and cannot be changed.

shifting.days: The execution is {{days}} days behind schedule.
shifting.weeks: The execution is {{weeks}} weeks behind schedule.

oldinterval.description: The interval is retained. The next execution is calculated from the planned execution date.

nextschedule.title: Executiondate of next schedule event

subtitle.done: You have successfully acknowledged this maintenance step.

send.anyways: Are you sure you want to send it anyway?

send.tooltip: The individual work steps must be marked as completed.

header.extra: When a template is selected, the system adopts its attributes unless the maintenance plan overrides them. User notifications can be configured via permissions. If a user views the maintenance plan, they will be notified when it is due, if configured.

info.description: Each row shows a schedule for the selected source. The table is sorted by the next execution time.
info.title: Overview of Upcoming Maintenance

overview.selectInfo: Subordinate sources are taken into account
overview.title: Schedule overview for {{source}}

admin.headerextra: Maintenance plan templates help you to design maintenance plans. The templates can be added to multiple data sources and then become active for these data sources. The system automatically creates a maintenance plan for the assignment of template to data source.

date.label: Please enter the date of execution
date.title: Date

items.label: Please select the used article for '{{source}}'
items.title: Used article

newschedule.description: Maintenance schedules created for selected sources: {{sources}}
newschedule.title: Maintenance schedule template created from selected data sources

info.description: You can apply filters to see which fields contain the matching value.
info.label: This section displays all metadata related to attachments.

issuecategory.select: Wich issue categories should be considered?

notification.title: A task was assigned to your role.

error.empty: Please assign the issue to someone.

help.help: The help text is displayed below the input field.
help.label: Help text

label.help: If no entry is made, a default value is used. If a '-' is entered, no label is displayed.

placeholder.help: If no entry is made, a default value is used. If a '-' is entered, no placeholder is displayed.
placeholder.label: Placeholder in input field

required.help: Indicates whether the field is required to be able to save the task.
required.label: Required

form.noSaveConfig: There is no form available for you to create a task. Please contact your maintenance department.

manual.description: Search the code name in the selection underneath.

modal.info: Keep the code in the red marked area.

error.empty: Enter a title. Example: "Cable broken" or "Pillars bended"

error.duplicate: The field id should be unique. This config could lead to unexpected behaviour.
